item.description:
Revolve Nation is continuously working to provide our members with great opportunities to netwok and learn from business leaders and entrepreneurs. As such, we have established an alliance with the Babson Alumni Entrepreneurship Forum (BAEF), to provide additional programming and networking events in the MetroWest area.

**NOTE: This event has a two-step registration process, see below.**

The next scheduled event that might be of interest to our group is a Panel Presentation entitled:

Starting a Business: What We've Learned


Date: Friday, September 26, 2008
Time: 2:00 p.m. - 3:30 p.m.
Place: Babson College, Olin Hall, Room Location TBD

Thinking about launching a business? Trying to grow your entrepreneurial venture? Contemplating an exit strategy to move onto something new? Looking for some guidance as you face these challenges? Join a panel of Babson alumni in various stages of business development as they share their trials, tribulations, and the rewards of starting a business. This is an opportunity to learn from the mistakes and successes of your peers. Their insights can help you start a business or take it to the next level.

The featured panelists are:

  • JP Carney M'00, Chief Operating Officer, Revolabs, Inc.
  • John Goscha '06, founder, Idea Paint, Inc.
  • Brian Goss M'06, Founder & CEO, Humanize the Web
  • Ken Pereira M'99, Co-Founder and Partner of Oridium, LLC


Tim Marken '81, Managing Director, Charity Partners, LLC and Babson Adjunt Professor of Entrepreneurship will serve as the moderator for the panel.

This panel presentation is part of Back to Babson 2008

There is a $15 charge to attend this event.

To register for this event please RSVP "yes" on meetup, AND click HERE. You must register with Babson College in order to attend this event.
item.name: Starting a Business: What We've Learned
